trans-unit.source: Configures the security settings of a `basicHttpBinding` binding.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurity"></xref> class.
Gets the message-level security settings for a `basicHttpBinding` binding.

The default security settings are: a <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageSecurity.ClientCredentialType%2A> of <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageCredentialType.UserName>; and an <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageSecurity.AlgorithmSuite%2A> of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.Basic256%2A>.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpMessageSecurity"></xref>, which represents the message-level security settings for this binding.
Gets or sets the security mode for a `basicHttpBinding` binding.
The value of this property affects which settings in <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurity.Message%2A> become effective.
The default value for this property is <xref href="System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.None"></xref>.
The value is not a legal value for <xref href="System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode"></xref>.
Determines whether a message element should be serialized.
`true` if the message should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the transport element should be serialized.
`true` if the transport element should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the transport-level security settings for a `basicHttpBinding` binding.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity> object returned by this property contains properties that control authentication parameters for the HTTP transport.
The transport-level security settings for a `basicHttpBinding` binding.
